goal.tools.errorhandling.exceptions

Class ExtendedParserException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • org.antlr.runtime.RecognitionException
          • goal.tools.errorhandling.exceptions.ParserException
            • goal.tools.errorhandling.exceptions.ExtendedParserException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ExtendedParserException
extends ParserException
    An extension to ParserException, also indicating the file (or other source) where the error originated from. It can also contain an inner exception that caused this exception.
    Author:
    N.Kraayenbrink
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructor and Description
      ExtendedParserException(org.antlr.runtime.IntStream input, java.lang.String reason, java.lang.Exception innerException, boolean showStack)
      Creates a new ExtendedParserException, with a given input source, a reason for the exception to have occurred, and the exception that triggered the new exception.
      ExtendedParserException(org.antlr.runtime.IntStream input, java.lang.String reason, java.io.File sourceFile)
      Creates a new ExtendedParserException, with a given input source, a reason for the exception to have occurred, and a name or description of the file (or other source) where the exception originated from.
      ExtendedParserException(org.antlr.runtime.IntStream input, java.lang.String reason, java.io.File sourceFile, java.lang.Exception innerException, boolean showStack)
      Creates a new ExtendedParserException, with a given input source, a reason for the exception to have occurred, the exception triggering the new exception, and the file (or other source) in which the original exception occurred.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void appendInnerException(java.lang.StringBuilder builder)
      Appends info about the exception that caused this exception to be created, but only if that info was set.
      If showStack has been set to true, also the stack trace of the inner exception (when present) is printed.
      void appendSourceInfo(java.lang.StringBuilder builder)
      Appends info about the file (or other source) where this exception occurred, but only if that info was set.

      void setInnerException(java.lang.Exception innerException, boolean showStack)
      Sets the exception that triggered this exception.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExtendedParserException

        public ExtendedParserException(org.antlr.runtime.IntStream input,
                       java.lang.String reason,
                       java.io.File sourceFile)
        Creates a new ExtendedParserException, with a given input source, a reason for the exception to have occurred, and a name or description of the file (or other source) where the exception originated from.
        Parameters:
        input - A reference to the faulty stream, at the position of the error made by the user. May be null, in which case that info can be set later using ParserException.setInputStream(IntStream).
        reason - Why the new exception occurred.
        sourceFile - In what file (or other source) the exception occurred.

      • ExtendedParserException

        public ExtendedParserException(org.antlr.runtime.IntStream input,
                       java.lang.String reason,
                       java.lang.Exception innerException,
                       boolean showStack)
        Creates a new ExtendedParserException, with a given input source, a reason for the exception to have occurred, and the exception that triggered the new exception.
        Parameters:
        input - A reference to the faulty stream, at the position of the error made by the user. May be null, in which case that info can be set later using ParserException.setInputStream(IntStream).
        reason - Why the new exception occurred.
        innerException - The Exception triggering the new ExtendedParserException.
        showStack - If the toString() method should print the stack trace of the inner exception (if present).

      • ExtendedParserException

        public ExtendedParserException(org.antlr.runtime.IntStream input,
                       java.lang.String reason,
                       java.io.File sourceFile,
                       java.lang.Exception innerException,
                       boolean showStack)
        Creates a new ExtendedParserException, with a given input source, a reason for the exception to have occurred, the exception triggering the new exception, and the file (or other source) in which the original exception occurred.
        Parameters:
        input - A reference to the faulty stream, at the position of the error made by the user. May be null, in which case that info can be set later using ParserException.setInputStream(IntStream).
        reason - Why the new exception occurred.
        sourceFile - In what file (or other source) the exception occurred.
        innerException - The Exception triggering the new ExtendedParserException.
        showStack - If the toString() method should print the stack trace of the inner exception (if present).

    • Method Detail

      • getInnerException

        public java.lang.Exception getInnerException()
        Returns:
        The exception that triggered this exception. May be null if none was given.

      • setInnerException

        public void setInnerException(java.lang.Exception innerException,
                     boolean showStack)
        Sets the exception that triggered this exception.
        Parameters:
        innerException - The exception that triggered this exception. May be null.
        showStack - If the stack trace of the given exception should be printed in this exception's toString() method.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class ParserException

      • appendSourceInfo

        public void appendSourceInfo(java.lang.StringBuilder builder)
        Appends info about the file (or other source) where this exception occurred, but only if that info was set.
        Parameters:
        builder - To which builder to append the info.

      • appendInnerException

        public void appendInnerException(java.lang.StringBuilder builder)
        Appends info about the exception that caused this exception to be created, but only if that info was set.
        If showStack has been set to true, also the stack trace of the inner exception (when present) is printed. Each element is printed on a new line with a tab character in front.
        Parameters:
        builder - To which builder to append the info.
